title: Got CUDNN_STATUS_NOT_INITIALIZED although PyTorch recognizes CUDA & CuDNN
body_html:
environment

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS
PyTorch version: 0.5.0a0+1483bb7
How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
Python version: 3.5.2
torch.backends.cudnn.version(): 7104
CUDA version: 9.0.176
NVIDIA driver version: 390.48 (tried with 390.67 as well)
GPU: Pascal Titan-X (CUDA compute capability 6.1)

I compiled PyTorch from source and tried to run the CIFAR classification code from here. I only move the network and mini batches to GPU and do the training. However, I get the following error at the beginning of training:

RuntimeError: CuDNN error: CUDNN_STATUS_NOT_INITIALIZED

Doing device = torch.device("cuda:0" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu") will correctly show me cuda:0. Then I do net.to(device) and inputs, labels = inputs.to(device), labels.to(device), although this line is not executed as my code crashes when converting the model modules to CuDNN modules.

Can anyone give me a clue why I get this error?

body:
**environment**

    OS: Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS
    PyTorch version: 0.5.0a0+1483bb7
    How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
    Python version: 3.5.2
    torch.backends.cudnn.version(): 7104
    CUDA version: 9.0.176
    NVIDIA driver version: 390.48 (tried with 390.67 as well)
    GPU: Pascal Titan-X (CUDA compute capability 6.1)

I compiled PyTorch from source and tried to run the CIFAR classification code from [here](https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/blitz/cifar10_tutorial.html#sphx-glr-beginner-blitz-cifar10-tutorial-py). I only move the network and mini batches to GPU and do the training. However, I get the following error at the beginning of training:

`RuntimeError: CuDNN error: CUDNN_STATUS_NOT_INITIALIZED`

Doing `device = torch.device("cuda:0" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")` will correctly show me `cuda:0`. Then I do `net.to(device)` and `inputs, labels = inputs.to(device), labels.to(device)`, although this line is not executed as my code crashes when converting the model modules to CuDNN modules.

Can anyone give me a clue why I get this error?
